lead_paragraph: The owner of the adultery-focused site, which was breached by hackers, will pay a sharply discounted penalty to settle an inquiry into lax data security and deceptive practices.

headline.print_headline: Adultery Site Reaches Deal to End Inquiry
headline.main: Ashley Madison Owner Reaches $1.6 Million Settlement

snippet: The owner of the adultery-focused site, which was breached by hackers, will pay a sharply discounted penalty to settle an inquiry into lax data security and deceptive practices....
abstract: Ruby Corporation, privately held owner of Ashley Madison website, will pay $1.66 million penalty for lax data security and deceptive practices following investigation by Federal Trade Commission and several states; website, which was advertised as discreet dating site for adulterers, was hacked several times from November 2014 to June 2015, exposing personal details of over 36 million customers.
